best_practices_and_examples.overview: Comprehensive best practices, implementation examples, and usage patterns for the Dynamic Rule Manager mode, ensuring effective adoption and consistent application of the six-pillar framework.

template_design_principles.principle: Each template should focus on one specific rule domain
Templates should be designed for composition and extension
Template interfaces should maintain backward compatibility
Every template must include comprehensive documentation and examples

interface_specification_guidelines.guideline: All interfaces must include JSON Schema validation
Interface changes must follow semantic versioning principles
Breaking changes require deprecation notices and migration paths
Interfaces must specify error conditions and handling strategies

common_antipatterns.antipattern: Avoid creating overly complex templates that try to handle everything
Avoid templates that are tightly coupled to specific implementations
Avoid creating new template versions for minor changes

naming_conventions.convention: Use dot notation for hierarchical rule organization (module.domain.rule)
Rule names should clearly describe their purpose and scope
Include version information in rule identifiers when needed

dependency_management.practice: Use dependency injection patterns for flexible rule composition

consistency_standards.standard: Maintain consistent formatting across all rule definitions
Ensure all rules include required metadata fields
Apply consistent validation patterns across rule types

code_integration_patterns.pattern: Use decorators to bind rules to code functions and classes
Inject rule configurations through dependency injection

testing_strategies.strategy: Create unit tests for each rule's logic and behavior
Test rule interactions within module contexts
Use property-based testing for rule invariants
Maintain regression tests for rule changes

commit_message_standards.format: rule: [type] brief description of rule change
commit_message_standards.body_requirements: Include impact assessment and affected modules

branching_strategies.strategy: Create separate branches for rule changes
Use special branches for breaking rule changes
Establish procedures for urgent rule fixes

review_processes.process: Require peer review for all rule changes
Ensure documentation updates accompany rule changes

performance_considerations.consideration: Process only changed rules to optimize performance
Use parallel processing for impact analysis
Cache analysis results for frequently accessed rules

accuracy_improvements.improvement: Consider rule context in impact calculations
Weight impact predictions based on historical accuracy
Incorporate actual impact data to improve predictions

detection_tuning.tuning: Adjust similarity thresholds based on rule types
Consider rule context in duplicate detection
Implement heuristics to reduce false positives

consolidation_strategies.strategy: Implement consolidation in phases to reduce risk
Prepare rollback strategies for consolidation attempts
Communicate consolidation plans to affected teams

resolution_prioritization.priority: Prioritize resolutions that maintain system safety
Choose resolutions with minimal impact on existing functionality
Consider long-term maintainability in resolution choices

escalation_procedures.procedure: Escalate complex technical conflicts to senior engineers
Escalate business logic conflicts to domain experts
Escalate architectural conflicts to system architects

performance_optimization.optimization: Run validation steps in parallel when possible
Test only affected components for faster feedback
Optimize resource usage during rule processing

reliability_improvements.improvement: Implement retry logic for transient failures

phased_deployment.phase: Deploy rule validation in non-production environments first
Deploy rule changes to small subset of production traffic
Deploy to full production after validation success

rollback_procedures.procedure: Implement automated rollback triggers for critical failures
Provide manual rollback procedures for complex scenarios
Include data recovery procedures in rollback plans

validation_rule_template.content: id: template.validation.v1 version: "1.0.0" type: template description: Standard template for data validation rules interface: required_fields: - rule_id - validation_type - validation_criteria - error_handling optional_fields: - custom_validators - performance_hints schema: rule_id: type: string pattern: "^[a-z0-9._-]+$" validation_type: type: string enum: ["range", "format", "custom", "reference"] validation_criteria: type: object properties: min_value: {type: number} max_value: {type: number} format_pattern: {type: string} custom_function: {type: string} error_handling: type: object properties: error_level: {type: string, enum: ["warning", "error", "critical"]} error_message: {type: string} recovery_action: {type: string} implementation_binding: decorator: "@validation_rule" configuration_path: "rules.validation" runtime_check: true examples: - rule_id: "data.price.range_validation" validation_type: "range" validation_criteria: min_value: 0 max_value: 1000000 error_handling: error_level: "error" error_message: "Price must be between 0 and 1,000,000" recovery_action: "reject_record"

workflow_rule_template.content: id: template.workflow.v1 version: "1.0.0" type: template description: Standard template for workflow orchestration rules interface: required_fields: - rule_id - trigger_conditions - workflow_steps - completion_criteria optional_fields: - retry_policy - timeout_settings - notification_settings schema: rule_id: type: string pattern: "^[a-z0-9._-]+$" trigger_conditions: type: array items: type: object properties: condition_type: {type: string} condition_value: {type: string} workflow_steps: type: array items: type: object properties: step_name: {type: string} step_type: {type: string} step_config: {type: object} dependencies: {type: array, items: {type: string}} completion_criteria: type: object properties: success_conditions: {type: array} failure_conditions: {type: array} implementation_binding: orchestrator: "airflow" configuration_path: "workflows" monitoring_enabled: true examples: - rule_id: "data.processing.daily_etl" trigger_conditions: - condition_type: "schedule" condition_value: "0 2 * * *" # Daily at 2 AM workflow_steps: - step_name: "extract_data" step_type: "data_extraction" step_config: source: "trading_db" query: "daily_trades.sql" dependencies: [] - step_name: "transform_data" step_type: "data_transformation" step_config: script: "transform_trades.py" dependencies: ["extract_data"] - step_name: "load_data" step_type: "data_loading" step_config: target: "warehouse_db" table: "processed_trades" dependencies: ["transform_data"] completion_criteria: success_conditions: ["all_steps_completed"] failure_conditions: ["step_failure", "timeout_exceeded"]

ci_pipeline_configuration.content:
name: Rule Management Pipeline
on: push: paths: - 'rules/**' - '.roo/**' pull_request: paths: - 'rules/**' - '.roo/**'
jobs: rule-validation: runs-on: ubuntu-latest steps: - uses: actions/checkout@v3
- name: Set up Python uses: actions/setup-python@v4 with: python-version: '3.9'
- name: Install dependencies run: | pip install yamllint jsonschema pyyaml networkx
- name: Validate rule syntax run: | find rules/ .roo/ -name "*.yaml" -o -name "*.yml" | xargs yamllint
- name: Validate rule schemas run: | python scripts/validate_rule_schemas.py
- name: Check rule dependencies run: | python scripts/check_rule_dependencies.py
- name: Generate impact assessment run: | python scripts/generate_impact_assessment.py > impact_assessment.md
- name: Upload impact assessment uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3 with: name: impact-assessment path: impact_assessment.md
rule-testing: runs-on: ubuntu-latest needs: rule-validation steps: - uses: actions/checkout@v3
- name: Set up test environment run: | # Set up test environment docker-compose -f docker-compose.test.yml up -d
- name: Run rule tests run: | python -m pytest tests/rules/ -v --tb=short
- name: Generate test coverage report run: | coverage run -m pytest tests/rules/ coverage report --format=markdown > rule_test_coverage.md
- name: Upload test coverage uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3 with: name: test-coverage path: rule_test_coverage.md
deployment: runs-on: ubuntu-latest needs: [rule-validation, rule-testing] if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' steps: - uses: actions/checkout@v3
- name: Deploy rule changes run: | # Deploy validated rule changes python scripts/deploy_rules.py --environment production
- name: Update rule documentation run: | python scripts/generate_rule_documentation.py
- name: Notify stakeholders run: | python scripts/notify_rule_changes.py

steps.step: Create rule from template using mode commands
Submit rule change with impact assessment
Deploy rule change through CI/CD pipeline
Regular health assessment of existing rules

pattern.name: rule_change_notification
pattern.timing: Before, during, and after rule changes

pattern.name: health_reporting
pattern.frequency: Daily health summaries, weekly trend reports

issue.symptoms: Pre-commit hooks failing, CI pipeline errors
issue.causes: Syntax errors, schema violations, dependency conflicts

solutions.solution: Use schema validation tools to identify specific errors
Check rule dependencies for circular references
Add caching for frequently accessed rules
Use automated resolution for simple conflicts
